DOC.HEADLINE: THE WEEK AHEAD : MOSCOW ; THE ' NEAR ABROAD '
DOC.TEXT: Russian President Boris N . Yeltsin is scheduled to visit Georgia on Wednesday in his first trip to a former Soviet republic since the Dec . 12 Russian parliamentary election . Georgian leader Eduard A . Shevardnadze said the visit " will signify the recognition of Georgia ' s independence , " but Yeltsin ' s conduct will be scrutinized for clues about Russia ' s new policy toward the nations of the " near abroad. " Russia has supplied troops to help Shevardnadze put_down an armed rebellion , and Georgia has joined the Russian-led Commonwealth of Independent States . The leaders will sign agreements on friendship , free_trade and economic cooperation .
